item.title: UDP Protocol in Java
item.description:
What is UDP?

UDP (User Datagram Protocol) is a protocol that sends data quickly but doesn’t guarantee delivery. Think of it like sending regular mail - fast but might get lost.

TCP vs UDP Comparison

Criteria TCP UDP
Reliable ✓ Yes ✗ No
Speed Slow Fast
Connection Required Not needed
Used for Email, Web Video, Games

UDP Characteristics

  • Fast: No need to establish connection
  • Unreliable: Data might be lost
  • Unordered: Data might arrive out of order
  • Send packets: Each packet is independent

DatagramSocket and DatagramPacket

UDP uses DatagramSocket to send/receive data via DatagramPacket.

item.title: TCP Protocol in Java
item.description:
What is TCP?

TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) is a protocol that ensures data is sent completely, in order, and without errors. It’s like sending a registered letter - you know for sure the recipient will receive it.

TCP Characteristics

  • Reliable: Data is not lost
  • Ordered: Data arrives in the order it was sent
  • Flow control: Doesn’t send too fast
  • Slower than UDP: Because it checks many things

3-Way Handshake

Before sending data, TCP must establish a connection in 3 steps:
